meanings.definition: A device consisting of two rings mounted on axes at right angles to each other, used to keep an object horizontal regardless of the motion of its support.
meanings.sent1: The gimbal on the camera kept it steady while the boat rocked.
meanings.sent2: The engineer installed the gimbal to ensure the telescope stayed level.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten thought the gimbal was a fun toy to spin around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gimbal, always balancing work and family life.
meanings.sent5: The gimbal's purpose is to maintain stability in turbulent conditions.

meanings.definition: To mount on or provide with a gimbal.
meanings.sent1: He decided to gimbal the spotlight for better illumination.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will gimbal the radar system on the ship.
meanings.sent3: She tried to gimbal her phone on the drone for aerial shots.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a gimbal supporting his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully gimbaled the painting to display it at the perfect angle.
